quote: Welcome, Jack. Where hast thou been? Plague of all cowards, say, and a vengeance too!
Away, for Vengeance comes along with them. Nay, stay not to expostulate, make speed; or else come after; I'll away before.
That's a brave fellow, but he's vengeance proud and loves not the common people.

Vengeance, vengeance! M of my lawful pleasure she restrained and prayed me oft forbearance; did it with pudency so rosy the sweet view on 't might well have warmed old Saturn, that thought her as chaste as unsunned snow.

But as we often see against some storm silence in the heavens, the rack stand still, the bold winds speechless, and the orb below as hush as death, anon the dreadful thunder doth rend the region; so, after Pyrrhus' pause, aroused vengeance sets him new a-work, and never did the Cyclops' hammers fall on Mars's armor, forged for proof eterne, with less remorse than Pyrrhus' bleeding sword now falls on Priam.

Vengeance! Why, what an ass am This is most brave, that the son of a dear father murdered, prompted to my revenge by heaven and hell, must, like a whore, unpack my heart with words and fall a-cursing like a very drab, stallion!
If it be true, all vengeance comes too short which can pursue th' offender.
Vengeance, plague, death, confusion! "Fiery"? What "quality"?
All the stored vengeances of heaven fall on her ingrateful top!

No, Escanes, know this of me: antiochus from incest lived not free, for which the most high gods not minding longer to withhold the vengeance that they had in store due to this heinous capital offense, even in the height and pride of all his glory, when he was seated in a chariot of an inestimable value, and his daughter with him, fire from heaven came and shriveled up those bodies even to loathing, for they so stunk that all those eyes adored them, ere their fall, scorn now their hand should give them burial.
Vengeance on your crafty withered hide!-- yet have faced it with a card of ten.
play: (The Taming of the Shrew, Act 0, Scene 168)

quote: Vengeance on 't, there 'tis! Now sir, this staff is my sister, for, look you, she is as white as a lily and as small as a wand.
play: (The Two Gentlemen of Verona, Act 2, Scene 9)

quote: This way, or not at all, stand you in hope. Come, come, our empress, with her sacred wit to villainy and vengeance consecrate, will we acquaint withal what we intend, and she shall file our engines with advice that will not suffer you to square yourselves, but to your wishes' height advance you both.
No, madam, these are no venereal signs. Vengeance is in my heart, death in my hand, blood and revenge are hammering in my head.
And had you not by wondrous fortune come, this vengeance on me had they executed.

Banished the kingdom? 'Tis a benefit, mercy must thank 'em for; but banished the free enjoying of that face die for, 'twas a studied punishment, a death beyond imagination--such a vengeance that, were old and wicked, all my sins could never pluck upon me.
My mind misgives me. This fellow has a vengeance trick o' th' hip.
It was thought meet paris should do some vengeance on the Greeks.
After this, the vengeance on the whole camp! O rather, the Neapolitan bone-ache!
Let him be until a time may serve. For present vengeance, take it on her.
--the Queen, the Queen, the sweet'st, dear'st creature's dead, and vengeance for 't not dropped down yet.
